Entry.Value: Man-portable dual-wavelength guided missile launcher. The missiles' IR/UV fire-and-forget guidance system gives them superb accuracy.
Single-shot tranquilizer handgun. This miniaturized tranquilizer gun delivers an immobilization agent from a distance, but has poor rapid-fire capability as each round must be loaded manually.
.45 caliber automatic handgun. Boasts impressive anti-personnel stopping power at close range, and a reliable frame design that is unlikely to jam.
Soviet 9mm automatic handgun. A medium-caliber handgun with a good balance between stopping power and recoil.
7.65mm compact submachine gun. The use of low-caliber ammunition has allowed for a truly compact design. Ideal for clearing confined spaces.
Soviet 7.62mm assault rifle. Larger-barrel version of the SVG-76. Though the larger bore provides greater stopping power, the increased recoil makes the weapon somewhat hard to handle.
5.56mm light carbine. Standard model with the greatest balance between effective range, accuracy, and ease of handling.
Double-barreled hunting shotgun. Only holds two shells, but is powerful enough at close range to send an enemy flying.
Pump-action shotgun. Has limited ammo, but enough power at close range to send enemies flying.
40mm single-shot grenade launcher. Uses cased ammunition for greater accuracy, further enhanced by its high-precision barrel. Also boasts a long effective range.
Soviet 7.62mm sniper rifle. High-precision rifle used extensively in the field since WWII. Its bolt action gives it excellent accuracy, but also a slow rate of fire.
7.62mm sniper rifle. Features superb effective range and power, but a slow rate of fire due to its bolt action.
7.62mm general-purpose machine gun. Delivers powerful rounds at a continuous rate of fire.
5.56mm general-purpose machine gun. This squad fire support weapon combines belt-fed rapid fire capability with an ease of handling comparable to an assault rifle.
Soviet rocket-propelled grenade launcher. Cheaper to use than other launchers, and also easy to modify.
An empty ammunition magazine. Throw near enemy to create a noise distraction. Tap the Attack Button (<I=G=ATTACK>) to perform a quick toss. Hold the button to perform a long-range throw.

Flare grenade (helicopter). A luminescent signal used to call in a support helicopter to a specific location. *Restricts mission completion rank to an A or below, and cannot be used during FOB Missions.
Flare grenade (supply drop). A luminescent signal used to mark a drop site for ammunition or suppressors. *Cannot be used during FOB Missions.
Fragmentation grenade. Can be tossed over obstacles to strike enemy targets in cover.
Smoke grenade. Releases a smokescreen to obscure enemy visibility.
A radio-detonated bomb. Perfect for special tactics such as ambushes. After placing, detonate by pressing the Ready Button (<I=G=HOLD>) and the Action Button (<I=G=ACTION>).
Decoy. After throwing, press the Ready Button (<I=G=HOLD>) and the Action Button (<I=G=ACTION>) to deploy a diversionary balloon that looks like a soldier.
Active decoy. Standard decoy upgraded with a speaker function. Deploys a diversionary balloon that also plays continuous voice clips. *No sound if deployed to FOB.
Directional mine. Anti-personnel/anti-vehicle mine. Detonates when a moving object enters its trigger area.
Sleeping gas mine. Releases soporific gas when a target enters its trigger area, putting those who inhale the gas to sleep.
Anti-tank mine. Large mine powerful enough to destroy armored vehicles. Not triggered by personnel or animals.
Electromagnetic net mine. Special mine that uses powerful electromagnetic attraction to capture vehicles.
40mm 6-round grenade launcher. Maintains long-range attack capability while enabling rapid fire. However, it is heavier and harder to handle.
7.62mm semi-auto sniper rifle. Expensive to develop, but avoids the drop in accuracy that usually accompanies an increased rate of fire.
12.7mm anti-materiel rifle. High-caliber sniper rifle boasting incredible power and penetration, though its bolt action gives it a slow rate of fire.
Warhead-specific large-caliber recoilless rifle. Customized to fire special warheads.
Multi-lock homing missile. The warhead is packed with multiple fire-and-forget auto-homing mini-missiles, for suppressing numerous targets in a single shot.
Flashbang grenade. Incapacitates nearby enemies upon detonation.
Molotov cocktail. Improvised incendiary weapon made from a bottle and fuel mixed with a thickening agent.
7.65mm compact submachine gun. Boasts a higher rate of fire than other submachine guns, putting out more rounds in a shorter time.
9mm high-accuracy submachine gun. Has the same internal mechanism as an assault rifle, giving it greater accuracy than other submachine guns.
7.62mm full-length assault rifle. Its precision-machined long barrel gives it greater accuracy than other assault rifles.
Automatic shotgun. Combines the power of a traditional shotgun with a large-capacity magazine.
Soviet 7.62mm general-purpose machine gun. Delivers powerful rounds at a continuous rate of fire. The trade-off for its rapid fire capability is the heavy recoil.

Man-portable dual-wavelength guided missile launcher. The missiles' IR/UV fire-and-forget guidance system gives them superb accuracy, but they lack power due to the guidance device taking up much of the warhead's space.

Soviet 5.56mm assault rifle. Its stability and low cost have made licensed and unlicensed versions of this rifle a common sight not only in the hands of communist forces, but in war zones around the world.

Snake Custom stun gun prosthesis. Delivers a 1.2-megavolt electric shock capable of incapacitating enemies. Battery is charged by kinetic energy generated by the wearer's natural motions, supplemented by solar power.
Additional prosthesis function. Enables the use of echolocation to locate enemies, prisoners, and animals. Emits sound waves, so there is a risk of enemies noticing when used.
Air Shock Round Conversion (Attack Type: Non-lethal)
Sleeping Gas Round Conversion (Attack Type: Non-lethal)
Magazine Tube Extension 1 (Loaded Ammo Count Up)
Long Banana Magazine (Loaded Ammo Count Up)
Magazine Tube Extension 2 (Loaded Ammo Count Up)
Short Barrel Conversion (Firing Speed/Auto-Aim Range Up)
Short Barrel Conversion (Firing Speed/Auto-Aim Range Up)
Snub Nose Conversion (Firing Speed/Auto-Aim Range Up)
Ultra-short Barrel Conversion (Firing Speed/Auto-Aim Range Up)
Enhanced Stock Performance (Improved Stability While Moving)
Additional Option Slot (2x Upper Option Slots)
High Firing Rate Receiver (Firing Speed Up)
All-purpose bait. Uses a special blend of medicinal plants to stimulate the appetite of animals. Will attract and fixate wild animals.
Sleeping gas grenade. Disperses gas containing a high volume of soporific agent, putting nearby enemies to sleep.
9mm handgun with an unconventional design. The lightweight slide enables smoother rapid-fire capability.

.44 caliber revolver. Uses larger-caliber rounds than automatic pistols for unrivaled anti-personnel stopping power at close range, but is inferior to automatics in terms of reload speed and ammunition capacity.

Handgun designed to fire shotshells. The power of shotshells combined with close-quarters maneuverability makes for incredible anti-personnel stopping power. The enlarged chamber enables multiple ammunition types to be loaded.
Hand cannon designed to fire grenades. Delivers grenades more accurately and over a longer range than hand-throwing, and offers effectiveness against hard targets as well as soft.
Water-based weapon system. Operating the finely-tuned trigger connected to the high-capacity water pump launches a controlled stream of water from the muzzle.
.45-caliber revolver decorated with high-quality engraving, rumored to have been used by a notorious triple-crosser. But does it give you a tactical advantage...?
Based on a reliable revolver much loved by veteran gunfighters, but combat customized and given a flat, menacing olive drab paintjob.
Stun decoy. Standard decoy upgraded with an electric shock function. When popped, unleashes a powerful electric surge that incapacitates enemies.
Animal capture cage. Placing these in the area of operations enables humane capture of small to mid-sized animals. Support Unit will handle extraction of captured animals.
Snake Custom capture prosthesis. Fires its detachable "Wisp" weapon forward, capturing and pulling target soldiers/prisoners back toward the user.

Snake Custom remote control prosthesis. The miniature camera-equipped hand can be released to run free and incapacitate distant enemies. Once released, the hand is controlled using <I=G=MOVE>, accelerating with <I=G=PAD_R2> and decelerating with <I=G=PAD_L2>.

Snake Custom remote control prosthesis. The miniature camera-equipped hand can be released to run free and harm distant enemies. Once released, the hand is controlled using <I=G=MOVE>, accelerating with <I=G=PAD_R2> and decelerating with <I=G=PAD_L2>.

9mm general-purpose submachine gun. Has a good balance of handling and stopping power, with a frame that can accept a number of upgrades. Trades accuracy for stopping power, meaning fewer rounds on target at longer ranges.
9mm high-accuracy submachine gun. Customized model featuring a short barrel and sharpshooter's stock. A stripped-down, quick personal defense weapon - the ideal sidearm.
5.56mm bullpup assault rifle. Specialized assault weapon made shorter by positioning the action behind the trigger, which also enables quicker aiming and firing.
Bullpup shotgun. Uses a bullpup design that places the chamber to the rear of the weapon, reducing muzzle rise when it is fired.
Sawed-off double-barreled shotgun. A powerful hunting gun with its long barrels sawed off. This shining gold "Persuader" is sure to make enemies see things your way.

Caseless grenade launcher. The simplified construction of this single-shot grenade launcher makes for an all-round better shooting experience, but the grenades' internalized propellant means weaker capabilities than similar ammunition.

Magazine-loading grenade launcher. This grenade launcher is fitted with a magazine port for rapid firing and quicker reloads. Since miniaturization of the grenades has proven difficult, there is little prospect of diverse ammunition types being developed for this weapon.

7.62mm semi-auto sniper rifle. Uses various existing components to help lessen development cost. Since its design focuses on rapid firing, it suffers a comparative drop in accuracy. Uses a lightweight skeletonized stock.

Man-portable defensive equipment that combines metal plating and an aramid weave to be exceptionally bulletproof. Carried on the back, it can be raised using the <I=G=HOLD> button. (Only secondary weapons can be used while shield is raised.)

Silver-painted, man-portable defensive equipment that combines metal plating and an aramid weave to be exceptionally bulletproof. Carried on the back, it can be raised using the <I=G=HOLD> button. (Only secondary weapons can be used while shield is raised.)

Olive drab, man-portable defensive equipment that combines metal plating and an aramid weave to be exceptionally bulletproof. Carried on the back, it can be raised using the <I=G=HOLD> button. (Only secondary weapons can be used while shield is raised.)

White-painted, man-portable defensive equipment that combines metal plating and an aramid weave to be exceptionally bulletproof. Carried on the back, it can be raised using the <I=G=HOLD> button. (Only secondary weapons can be used while shield is raised.)

Gold-painted, man-portable defensive equipment that combines metal plating and an aramid weave to be exceptionally bulletproof. Carried on the back, it can be raised using the <I=G=HOLD> button. (Only secondary weapons can be used while shield is raised.)
30mm cannon. A heavy automatic cannon that is often seen fitted to fighter aircraft and gunships in addition to ground armament. Powerful enough to destroy even armored vehicles.
20mm cannon. Favored as an anti-air weapon due to the constant stream of fire provided by its high firing rate. Also well suited to providing suppressing fire in ground combat.
130mm rocket launcher. Quick-fires volleys of unguided rockets for wide area suppression. Not suited to precise aiming.
105mm tank gun. Features a rifled inner barrel for greater accuracy. Also fitted to armored vehicles due to its superior reliability.
125mm tank gun. A smoothbore gun (the inner barrel features no rifling). Capable of firing more powerful ammunition, but accuracy suffers as a result.
105mm tank gun. Features a rifled inner barrel for greater accuracy. Its highly accurate fire makes it a thoroughly reliable piece of equipment.
BTS Instrument Design Bureau Uragan-5 Pistol
Arms Material Multipurpose Rifle System Model 4
Arms Material Multipurpose Rifle System Type 71 Precision Model
Killer Bee Surface to Air Missile-81
9mm general-purpose submachine gun. Has a good balance of handling and stopping power, with a frame that can accept a number of upgrades. Equipped with a flashlight.
9mm high-accuracy submachine gun. Has the same internal mechanism as an assault rifle, giving it greater accuracy than other submachine guns. Equipped with a flashlight.
7.65mm compact submachine gun. The use of low-caliber ammunition has allowed for a truly compact design. Equipped with a flashlight.
7.65mm compact submachine gun. The use of low-caliber ammunition has allowed for a truly compact design. Customized with various upgrades including a high firing rate receiver.
7.65mm compact submachine gun. The use of low-caliber ammunition has allowed for a truly compact design. Equipped with a flashlight.
Pump-action shotgun. Has limited ammo, but enough power at close range to send enemies flying. Fitted with a standard stock [2] for improved shot grouping.
Pump-action shotgun. Has limited ammo, but enough power at close range to send enemies flying. Converted to use air shock rounds, and fitted with a standard stock [2] for improved shot grouping.
5.56mm light carbine. Standard model with the greatest balance between effective range, accuracy, and ease of handling. The long barrel conversion has given it added effective range.
7.62mm full-length assault rifle. Its precision-machined long barrel gives it greater accuracy than other assault rifles. Equipped with a 4x rifle scope.
7.62mm assault rifle. Equipped with a short barrel that sacrifices effective range for a favorable balance between stopping power and handling.
5.56mm light carbine. Standard model with the greatest balance between effective range, accuracy, and ease of handling. The long barrel conversion has given it added effective range.
7.62mm full-length assault rifle. Its precision-machined long barrel gives it greater accuracy than other assault rifles. Converted to fire rubber bullets.

7.62mm full-length assault rifle. Its precision-machined long barrel gives it greater accuracy than other assault rifles. Converted to fire rubber bullets, and customized to Diamond Dogs specifications.

Soviet 7.62mm assault rifle. Its stability and low cost have made licensed and unlicensed versions of this rifle a common sight not only in the hands of communist forces, but in war zones around the world. Fitted with a standard stock [1] that has worsened its shot grouping.

Soviet 7.62mm assault rifle. Its stability and low cost have made licensed and unlicensed versions of this rifle a common sight not only in the hands of communist forces, but in war zones around the world. Equipped with a 4x rifle scope.
7.62mm sniper rifle. Features superb effective range and power, but a slow rate of fire due to its bolt action. Equipped with a laser sight.
7.62mm semi-auto sniper rifle. Expensive to develop, but avoids the drop in accuracy that usually accompanies an increased rate of fire. Equipped with a laser sight.
7.62mm semi-auto sniper rifle. Expensive to develop, but avoids the drop in accuracy that usually accompanies an increased rate of fire. Converted to fire tranquilizer rounds.
5.56mm general-purpose machine gun. This squad fire support weapon combines belt-fed rapid fire capability with an ease of handling comparable to an assault rifle. Equipped with a short scope.
Warhead-specific large-caliber recoilless rifle. Customized to fire special warheads. Converted to fire sleeping gas rounds.
Soviet rocket-propelled grenade launcher. Cheaper to use than other launchers, and also easy to modify. Converted to use tandem warheads for greater damage on target.
Training rifle. A wooden mockup of a rifle, used to teach new recruits the basics of handling a weapon.
Skull Custom. A unique sawed-off lever-action rifle that was personally customized by Skull Face.

A defensive shield with a simple alloy construction. Used extensively by everything from civilian to military organizations. Carried on the back, and raised using the Ready Button (<I=G=HOLD>) to defend against attacks from the front. Only secondary weapons can be used while the shield is raised.

A riot control shield constructed of lightweight metal. Used extensively by everything from civilian to military organizations. Carried on the back, and raised using the Ready Button (<I=G=HOLD>) to defend against attacks from the front. Only secondary weapons can be used while the shield is raised.
A submachine gun designed to fire rubber bullets for riot control. Has poor accuracy, but will neutralize enemies without killing them.
Soviet 7.62mm sniper rifle. High-precision rifle used extensively in the field since WWII. Its bolt action gives it excellent accuracy, but also a slow rate of fire. Equipped with a laser sight.

7.62mm semi-auto sniper rifle. Uses various existing components to help lessen development cost. Since its design focuses on rapid firing, it suffers a comparative drop in accuracy. Uses a lightweight skeletonized stock. Equipped with a laser sight.

Soviet 7.62mm sniper rifle. High-precision rifle used extensively in the field since WWII. Its bolt action gives it excellent accuracy, but also a slow rate of fire. Equipped with a laser sight, and converted to fire tranquilizer rounds.
Large-caliber semi-auto sniper rifle. Enables semi-automatic firing of the excellent general-purpose, flat-trajectory 12.7mm round. Its rapid fire rate and awesome power are a sight to behold.
Single-shot handgun. This miniaturized gun delivers an immobilization agent from a distance, but has poor rapid-fire capability as each round must be loaded manually.
9mm automatic handgun. Boasts impressive anti-personnel stopping power at close range, and a reliable frame design that is unlikely to jam.

10mm general-purpose submachine gun. Has a good balance of handling and stopping power, with a frame that can accept a number of upgrades. Trades accuracy for stopping power, meaning fewer rounds on target at longer ranges.

Soviet 7.62mm assault rifle. Its stability and low cost have made licensed and unlicensed versions of this rifle a common sight not only in the hands of communist forces, but in war zones around the world.
5.56mm semi-auto sniper rifle. Expensive to develop, but avoids the drop in accuracy that usually accompanies an increased rate of fire.
Arms Material Multipurpose Rifle System Type 73 Precision Model
9mm bullpup assault rifle. Specialized assault weapon made shorter by positioning the action behind the trigger, which also enables quicker aiming and firing.
Mission Complete Rank Restricted to A or Below

Single-shot tranquilizer gas handgun. A compact non-lethal weapon used for delivering an immobilization agent from a distance. Each round disperses gas upon impact, for immediate effect across a small area. Has a slow rate of fire since each round must be loaded manually.
40mm single-shot grenade launcher. Uses cased ammunition for greater accuracy, and provides a wide casualty radius due to its multiple-warhead dispersal design.
12.7mm anti-materiel rifle. A large-caliber sniper rifle with an extremely long effective range and devastating power and penetration. Has a slow rate of fire due to its bolt-action mechanism.

E-RB Wormhole Generator. Remotely activated, it allows the user to warp to the location where it was placed. Once placed, hold the Ready Button (<I=G=HOLD>) and press the Action Button (<I=G=ACTION>) to activate. * Can be used only during FOB Missions.

SURVEILLANCE CAMERA MARKING DEVICE A handgun-type invisible light pointer used on your FOB to specify positions to place your surveillance cameras/gun cameras. Aim at a vertical wall surface and "fire" to automatically place a camera. That will be the designated placement for the camera from then on. However, cameras cannot be set on surfaces blocked by obstacles.

DIRECTIONAL MINE MARKER A landmine-type indicator used on your FOB to specify positions for directional mines/sleeping gas mines. Hold the Ready Button (<I=G=HOLD>) and press the Attack Button (<I=G=ATTACK>) to place the dummy mine, which will be replaced with a real mine during actual FOB missions. *To make this item available for development, you must first develop either the [M21 D-MINE Grade: 5] or [LLG-MINE Grade: 5].
When discovering an FOB intruder, Security Team staff will use Stealth Camo for a fixed time.
Battery Vaporization Device Effect Range Up
TORNADO-6 Ocelot's revolver of choice. Bullets can be ricocheted off walls and other objects to strike nearby enemy soldiers.
Decoy enemy field of movement generator. Confuses defender's Intel Team's Scouting function, creating a dummy enemy field of movement where thrown.
Anti-tranquilization agent. Stops tranquilizers up to a certain grade from circulating through the body over time. Only effective on security guards.
